p: Okoume essential oil has a significant inhibitory effect against S. aureus (20 mm) and a moderate inhibitory effect for E. coli (6 mm). In the literature, essential oils with higher concentrations of components including: δ-3-carene, linalool, α-pinene, β-pinene, limonene, 1, 8-cineole [ 58], and terpineol [ 59] have been reported to show enhanced antibacterial activity. These findings are consistent with the results reported here for the essential oil extracted from Aucoumea klaineana (okoume).
